what?
do you use a framebuffer console?
what is that
ah, ok =) a framebuffer console allows you to run your text console in supported vesa modes
in the case of radeonfb (the radeon framebuffer kernel module) you can also run in nonstandard modes... my text console behind X is 1280x800
oh, sounds cool
if I use fglrx, I can't switch to my console without getting screen corruption when I switch back to X... and it can only be solved by restarting the x server
of course, it's still an improvement over the old fglrx, where switching down to a framebuffer console would lock up the computer
well I didnt know you can make the text console outside X run at a different resolution
give it a try... if you're using the ubuntu stock kernel, just add "radeonfb" to /etc/mkinitrd/modules and dpkg-reconfigure (kernel version)
on reboot you'll get a high-res console
dpkg-reconfigure linux-i386 ?
nope, you'll have to reconfigure the package that actually contains the kernel... for me, it's "linux-image-2.6.10-5-686"
